meanings.definition: To force upon or impose something on someone else.
meanings.sent1: The salesman kept foisting unnecessary products on the customer.
meanings.sent2: She was known for foisting her opinions on others without considering their feelings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried foisting his chores onto his little sister.
meanings.sent4: The dictator was foisting his propaganda on the citizens through the state-controlled media.
meanings.sent5: The teacher caught the student foisting his homework on his classmates.

meanings.definition: To pass off as genuine or valuable.
meanings.sent1: The con artist was skilled at foisting fake paintings on unsuspecting buyers.
meanings.sent2: He tried foisting the counterfeit money on the cashier, but she immediately noticed.
meanings.sent3: The prankster thought he could foist his homemade cookies as store-bought treats.
meanings.sent4: She felt guilty for foisting her responsibilities onto her colleague.
meanings.sent5: The magician was foisting his tricks as real magic to the audience.
